c:complexType.name: CategoricalContinuousChartCommonOptions
c:complexType.c:documentation: The common options documentation class of Categorical charts with a continuous orthogonal axis.

c:property.name: visualRoles
c:property.c:documentation: The visual roles common to categorical chart types with a continuous orthogonal axis.

c:property.name: extensionPoints
c:property.c:documentation: The extension points object contains style definitions for various visual elements of the chart.

c:complexType.name: CategoricalContinuousChartCommonExtensionPoints
c:complexType.c:documentation:
The extension points of the categorical chart types with a continuous orthogonal axis.
To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
extension property (ex: smallBase)
the "_" character
extension sub-property (ex: strokeStyle)
and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: smallBase_strokeStyle (see ).

c:complexType.name: CategoricalContinuousCommonVisualRoles
c:complexType.c:documentation: The visual roles common to categorical chart types with a continuous orthogonal axis.

c:complexType.name: CategoricalContinuousPlotCommonOptions
c:complexType.c:documentation: The common options documentation class of categorical plot types with a continuous orthogonal axis.

c:property.name: stacked
c:property.c:documentation: Indicates that visual elements having identical category, but different series, should be displayed on top of each other, along the plot's orthogonal direction, instead of side-by-side, along the base direction.

c:property.name: nullInterpolationMode
c:property.c:documentation:
The interpolation mode used to fill-in null or missing values.
The interpolation is applied to the measure roles of the plot that are represented in the orthogonal cartesian axis.
With the exception of the box plot, this role is the value role. All of the box plot measure roles: median, lowerQuartil, upperQuartil, minimum, and maximum, are interpolated using the specified mode.

c:property.name: orthoAxis
c:property.c:documentation:
The index of the orthogonal cartesian axis to use for the plot.
The possible values are 1, 2 and 3.
The main plot of a chart always uses the axis 1.
